body_html:
Scikit Learn only supports heterogeneous outputs, so can pack them into one matrix. In Tnesorflow you can have out output is float, one a number and another a string. And this is fairly regular case (like one classification that returns class index, probability and class string). Due to this we made decision to return different type output. Alternatively we can make that predict on SKCompat will work into for few simple cases and if they have multioutput model one will be not be using it.
…

body:
Scikit Learn only supports heterogeneous outputs, so can pack them into one
matrix. In Tnesorflow you can have out output is float, one a number and
another a string. And this is fairly regular case (like one classification
that returns class index, probability and class string).
 Due to this we made decision to return different type output.

Alternatively we can make that predict on SKCompat will work into for few
simple cases and if they have multioutput model one will be not be using it.

On Mar 11, 2017 5:09 PM, "Jeff Heaton" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> For models with several outputs, you would probably want to follow the way
> other scikit-learn models handle this. If you are going for scikit-learn
> compatibility.
>
> http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.multioutput.
> MultiOutputRegressor.html
>
> —
